thread.title: Madonna posts Instagram pictures introducing newly adopted twin girls from Malawi
thread.title_full: Madonna posts Instagram pictures introducing newly adopted twin girls from Malawi

author: Reuters
title: Madonna posts Instagram pictures introducing newly adopted twin girls from Malawi
text:
Madonna posts Instagram pictures introducing newly adopted twin girls from Malawi Madonna confirmed the adoption on her Instagram with this picture of her and the twins Credit: Instagram/Madonna Reuters 8 February 2017 â€¢ 10:58pm 
P op star Madonna debuted two new daughters on social media on Wednesday, confirming she had completed her adoption of the twins from Malawi and was "overjoyed" to bring them into her family. 
She posted a photo on Instagram of herself walking along a rural path with the girls, who were wearing identical blue and white dresses and one wearing a hat. Madonna tours the Mphandura orphanage near Lilongwe, Malawi in 2013 Credit: AO 
"I am deeply grateful to all those in Malawi who helped make this possible, and I ask the media please to respect our privacy during this transitional time," the singer said in her post. 
T he children were previously reported to be four years of age and named Stella and Esther. According to reports they spent the last two years in the Home of Hope in Mchinji. 
Madonna and the twins' father were in court to observe proceedings earlier in the week. The children's mother is understood to have died a week after giving birth in 2012 from caesarian section complications. Madonna photographed with David and Lourdes in 2007 Credit: Reuters 
M adonna adopted Malawian children David Banda and Mercy James in 2006 and 2009 . She has two other children, Lourdes and Rocco, from previous relationships. 
The singer previously denied reports that she wanted to adopt again after she visited Malawi last month, at the time saying her trip was for her charity work. 
She established the non-profit Raising Malawi in 2006 to provide health and education programs, particularly for girls.
